revised_title: Spectra of Neon, Krypton, and Xenon: A Comprehensive Study
tldr: This study investigates the spectra of neon, krypton, and xenon, discovering that their spectra consist of bright, well-defined lines similar to those of argon and helium. The most striking spectrum is neon's, which contains predominantly orange and red lines. Krypton and xenon have two spectra, one obtained with a direct discharge and another with a Leyden jar and spark gap, both more complex than the first spectrum.
